quiz.question: What is the primary purpose of Unit Testing in mobile app development?
options: To test the entire application as a whole
To test individual components or functions in isolation
To ensure the app's UI is responsive
To evaluate the app's performance under stress
quiz.hint: Unit Testing focuses on small parts of the application.

quiz.question: Which of the following tools is commonly used for UI Testing in Android applications?
options: JUnit
Espresso
XCTest
Mockito
quiz.hint: This tool is specifically designed for Android UI testing.

quiz.question: In iOS app development, which tool is used for performing Unit Tests?
options: XCUITest
Espresso
JUnit
XCTest
quiz.hint: This tool is part of the Xcode testing framework.

quiz.question: What is Widget/Component Testing primarily focused on?
options: Testing the integration of multiple systems
Testing individual UI elements in isolation
Testing the app's network requests
Testing the app's security features
quiz.hint: It involves testing visual and interaction parts of the app.

quiz.question: During Integration Testing, what is the main objective?
options: To test only the back-end services
To identify issues when combining different modules or services
To improve the app's graphical user interface
To isolate individual units for testing
quiz.hint: This testing type ensures different parts of the app work together.
